"After the concerns expressed by some sectors of society, we have deemed it pertinent to make the following clarifications regarding the new social distancing measures adopted by the Government this December 15 through Decree 698-20," said Germán.      Here are the details:    "Now we have two different hours for the curfew, depending on the locality. On the one hand, in the National District and the provinces of Santo Domingo, Santiago, Duarte, La Vega and Puerto Plata this applies every day from 7:00 pm to 5:00 am ”, explained Germán.      While, in the rest of the country, the curfew applies from Monday to Friday from 9:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m. and Saturdays, Sundays and holidays from 7:00 p.m. to 5:00 a.m.     The spokesperson for the Presidency clarified the limitations of the new measures in relation to transfer to homes. “At these times that we have indicated, all curfew restrictions begin to apply, including the closure of public spaces, with the only exception that those days and places in which the curfew begins at 7: 00 pm, a two-hour grace period has been granted, that is, until 9:00 pm with the exclusive purpose that people can move quietly home, without the anguish that they will be detained for reasons beyond their control, such as the traffic jams that usually take place in hours close to curfew ”.    He added: “Regarding the gathering of people, it has been prohibited for more than 10 people to gather in public and private spaces for public use. This means that in these spaces more than 10 people can coincide at the same time, but they cannot gather in groups larger than that amount, as would happen in a shopping plaza, a transport station or a park ”.
